member.summary: Makes a deep copy of the video profile object.
member.returns: The copied object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.AutoFit
member.summary: Gets or set a value indicating whether the output resolution is calculated by fitting the source media item within the profile's size. For example, if AutoFit is set to true and the profile is set to 320 x 240 with an aspect ratio of 16:9, the output size will be 320 x 180. If AutoFit is set to false, the output size will be 320 x 240 and the video will be encoded with non-square pixels.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.ActualAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets the actual aspect ratio of the video profile. Note that if you're using square pixels (when AutoFit equals true), the actual aspect ratio may be slightly different than the aspect ratio that is passed to the SetAspectRatio method, because the video frame dimensions are rounded to the nearest 4 or 16 pixels.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the aspect ratio used to encode the profile. If set to null, the aspect ratio is controlled by the width and height of the stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets or sets the bitrate to use when encoding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the video profile.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.Force16Pixels
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether auto-calculated dimensions are rounded to 16 pixels (true), or 4 pixels (false).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.FrameRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the frame rate in frames per second. Zero (0) means that frame rate of the source file will be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.KeyFrameDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the key frame distance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.Streams
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of streams.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.SeparateFilesPerStream
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a separate file is created for each stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.SmoothStreaming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the profile uses IIS Smooth Streaming. Note that if you're using VC-1, setting this property to true will cause the following properties to be set as follows: ClosedGop to true, AdaptiveGop to false, and OutputMode to ElementaryStreamSequenceHeader. When you are using Smooth Streaming, the bitrate of the streams must be either all ConstantBitrate or all VariableConstrainedBitrate.
member.remarks: Note that when you are using IIS Smooth Streaming with a VariableConstrainedBitrate the following properties are ignored because they are set automatically during encoding: AdaptiveDeadZone, BFrameCount, Complexity, DenoiseFilter, DifferentialQuantization, InLoopFilter, MotionChromaSearch, MotionMatchMethod, MotionSearchRange, NoiseEdgeRemovalFilter, and OverlapSmoothingFilter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VideoProfile.NumberOfEncoderThreads
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of threads used by the encoder. Defaults to 0 to allow the encoder to choose a value based on the video and the number of logical processors available.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ScreenCapture.ScreenCaptureJob.OutputPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the output path of the screen and webcam recording. The directory will be created if it doesn't exist. The filename formats are: Screen capture file: [OutputPath]\ScreenCapture_[Date Time].xesc Webcam capture file: [OutputPath]\Webcam_[Date Time].wmv. If the user defines OutputScreenCaptureFileName or OutputWebcamFileName, the corresponding output file will be used for the screen capture file name and the webcam capture file name instead of using OutputPath.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ScreenCapture.ScreenCaptureJob.OutputScreenCaptureFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the output path of the screen capture recording. If it is not defined, the screen capture output file name will be generated using the OutputPath property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.ScreenCapture.ScreenCaptureJob.OutputWebcamFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the output path of the webcam recording. If it is not defined, the webcam output file name will be generated using the OutputPath property.

member.summary: Gets the output webcam file name of the latest screen capture session started.
member.returns: An empty string when no webcam capture output is found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.InvalidOperationErrorException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

The list of arguments.

Thrown if a null or empty string is passed as a parameter.

member.returns: The found preset.
member.exception: Thrown if the profile cannot be found.

member.returns: A preset object.

Thrown if the parameter contains a path that does not resolve to a valid file.

member.summary: Is used to specify the advanced VC1 video profile.

member.summary: Is used to specify the main VC1 video profile.

member.summary: Is used to specify the simple VC1 video profile.

member.summary: The base class for VC1 video profiles.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VC1VideoProfile.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SimpleVC1VideoProfile class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.VC1VideoProfile.Complexity
member.summary: Gets or sets the complexity level. The range is Fastest to Best. A value of Fastest offers the best performance. A value of Best offers the best quality. Recommendation: For offline encoding, use Normal for a good balance of quality and encoding speed. Lower values produce much lower quality and higher values may result in much longer encoding time with only small improvements in quality. For live encoding, use the highest value that does not drop frames.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SimpleVC1VideoProfile class

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.Clone
member.summary: Makes a deep copy of the video profile object.
member.returns: The copied object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.SmoothStreaming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the profile uses Smooth Streaming. Note that if you're using VC-1, setting this property to true will cause the following properties to be set as follows. ClosedGop to true, AdaptiveGop to false, and OutputMode to ElementaryStreamSequenceHeader. When using Smooth Streaming, the bitrate of each stream must either be all ConstantBitrate or all VariableConstrainedBitrate. When using H264, setting this property to true will cause SceneChangeDetector to be set to false.
member.remarks: Note that when using Smooth Streaming with a VariableConstrainedBitrate the following properties are ignored, as they are set automatically when encoding. AdaptiveDeadZone, BFrameCount, Complexity, DenoiseFilter, DifferentialQuantization, InLoopFilter, MotionChromaSearch, MotionMatchMethod, MotionSearchRange, NoiseEdgeRemovalFilter, OverlapSmoothingFilter, SceneChangeDetector

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.AdaptiveDeadZone
member.summary: Gets or sets the adaptive dead zone setting.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.AdaptiveGop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether adaptive GOP behavior is used. When you specify true, the encoder resets the GOP at each key frame. When you specify false, the encoder maintains a regular key frame cadence, but the encoder may still insert extra scene-change key frames.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.ClosedGop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether open or closed GOPs are used. A closed GOP does not contain frames that depend on adjacent GOPs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.DenoiseFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether denoise filtering is turned on. The denoise filter is a noise-reduction filter. It can improve the quality of noisy video sources, such as film containing visible grain or video that contains noise as a result of low-light conditions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.KeyFrameDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the key frame distance in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.MotionChromaSearch
member.summary: Gets or sets the motion chroma search level, which controls whether and how color is used in motion searches.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.MotionMatchMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the motion match method. SAD provides the best performance. Hadamard provides the best quality. Macroblock adaptive configures the codec to make decisions about which method to use on each macroblock.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.NoiseEdgeRemovalFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether noise edge filtering is turned on. The noise edge removal filter detects noise in frame edges and removes it. The noise edge detection only works only for frame edges that contain three or fewer lines of noise. The filter copies lines adjacent to the noisy lines to complete the frame.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.OverlapSmoothingFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether overlap-smoothing filtering is turned on. The overlap-smoothing filter helps reduce blocking artifacts by smoothing the borders between adjacent macroblocks. This tends to make the image appear softer, but can improve the appearance of low bitrate video that contains many blocking artifacts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.MotionVectorCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value used to specify the method used by the codec to estimate the amount of processing required for motion vector coding. The codec uses the cost to determine which features will be used in encoding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.SimpleVC1VideoProfile.Codec
member.summary: Gets the codec type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MainVC1VideoProfile.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MainVC1VideoProfile class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MainVC1VideoProfile.Clone
member.summary: Makes a deep copy of the video profile object.
member.returns: The copied object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MainVC1VideoProfile.DifferentialQuantization
member.summary: Gets or sets the DifferentialQuantization value for the VideoProfile. Differential quantization (DifferentialQuantization) is a form of perceptual optimization where the amount of compression is varied on different parts of the frame. DifferentialQuantization enables macro blocks containing smooth or dark areas to be encoded at a quantizer level lower than the rest of the image, yielding more accurate encoding of details in those macro blocks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MainVC1VideoProfile.InLoopFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether in-loop filtering is turned on. The in-loop filter reduces blocking artifacts during encoding to improve the quality of P-frames and B-frames.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MainVC1VideoProfile.MotionSearchRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the motion search range, which controls the size of the area the codec will search for an element of a frame that may have moved since a previous frame. Larger search ranges can better detect fast motion, but require more processing time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.MainVC1VideoProfile.BFrameCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of B-frames between key frames.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdvancedVC1VideoProfile.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AdvancedVC1VideoProfile class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdvancedVC1VideoProfile.Clone
member.summary: Makes a deep copy of the video profile object.
member.returns: The copied object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdvancedVC1VideoProfile.SmoothStreaming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the profile uses Smooth Streaming. Note that if you're using VC-1, setting this property to true will cause the following properties to be set as follows: ClosedGop to be set to true, and OutputMode to ElementaryStreamSequenceHeader. When using Smooth Streaming the bitrate of each stream must be either all ConstantBitrate or all VariableConstrainedBitrate. When using H264, setting this property to true will cause SceneChangeDetector to be set to false.
member.remarks: Note that when you are using Smooth Streaming with a VariableConstrainedBitrate, the following properties are ignored because they are set automatically during encoding: AdaptiveDeadZone, BFrameCount, Complexity, DenoiseFilter, DifferentialQuantization, InLoopFilter, MotionChromaSearch, MotionMatchMethod, MotionSearchRange, NoiseEdgeRemovalFilter, OverlapSmoothingFilter, and SceneChangeDetector.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdvancedVC1VideoProfile.ClosedGop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether open or closed GOPs are used. A closed GOP does not contain frames that depend on adjacent GOPs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdvancedVC1VideoProfile.OutputMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the stream output mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.AdvancedVC1VideoProfile.OptimizeForAnimation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the encoding should be optimized for animation. Only effective if encoding to Smooth Streaming with a variable bit rate.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether ReferenceBFrames is turned on. This value is ignored if H264 GPU encoding is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.AdaptiveBFrames
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether sequence complexity determines B-frame placement. This value is ignored if H264 GPU encoding is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.SceneChangeDetector
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether key frames will automatically get created when a scene change is detected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.FastIntraDecisions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to apply faster coding decisions per frame to speed up encoding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.FastInterDecisions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to apply faster coding decisions across frames to speed up encoding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.SubPixelMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating subpixel searching mode. Full depth is quicker but less accurate and Half and Quarter provides the best quality at the cost of encoding time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.SliceCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the number of slices per frame. Dividing the frames into more slices improves encoding speed but reduces quality because it prevents searches between slices.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.KeyFrameDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the key frame distance in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.InLoopFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether in-loop filtering is turned on. The in-loop filter reduces blocking artifacts during encoding to improve the quality of P-frames and B-frames.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.MEPartitionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for the ME Partition Level. This defines the complexity of the ME partition decision for inter-predicted frames. A smaller partition level means higher complexity and usually produces better compression capability (or better quality at the same bitrate).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.ReferenceFrames
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of reference frames for inter-predicted frames.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Expression.Encoder.Profiles.BaselineH264VideoProfile.SearchRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the search range in pixels.
